docs.snippet: To keep her children off the Lower East Side’s streets after school, Yoshita Childress keeps them busy with Catholic Big Sisters and Big Brothers....
docs.lead_paragraph: To keep her children off the Lower East Side’s streets after school, Yoshita Childress keeps them busy with Catholic Big Sisters and Big Brothers.
docs.abstract: Catholic Charities, supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, provides Yoshita Childress and her children with $425 to buy a computer for the family.

docs.snippet: Use this series to find interesting nonfiction to spur writing or debate, to make “real-world” connections to textbook content, or just to inspire your students with what young people can do to change the world....
